result.msg: Originally inspired from Vlads posting.  Why create yet another VaR example?  To demonstrate VaR running on a modern architecture that has no vertical limit.  This is a functional, immutable, scaleable interpretation of a basic technique commonly used in finance. Code Available here and on github. https://github.com/kirkhas/zeppelin-notebooks/

paragraphs.title: Load Dependency
paragraphs.text:
%dep
z.reset() // clean up previously added artifact and repository
z.load("org.apache.commons:commons-math3:3.2")

paragraphs.title: Model Inputs
paragraphs.text:
// pick your stocks
val stocks     = z.input("1:List of Stocks", "ge,msft").toString.toUpperCase.split(",")
val shares     = z.input("2:Number of Shares", "200,400").toString.split(",")
val fromDate   = z.input("3:From Date", "2016-01-25").toString
val toDate     = z.input("4:To Date", "2016-01-27").toString
val futureDays = z.input("5:Number of Days you will hold these Stocks", 100).toString.toInt
val sims       = z.input("6:Number of Simulations", 10).toString.toInt
val sym2Shares = (stocks zip shares).toMap.toList
sc.parallelize(sym2Shares).toDF.registerTempTable("sym2Shares")

5:Number of Days you will hold these Sto.name: 5:Number of Days you will hold these Stocks
5:Number of Days you will hold these Sto.displayName: 5:Number of Days you will hold these Stocks

sims: Int = 10

paragraphs.title: Get Historical Data From Yahoo
paragraphs.text:
//format inputs
import java.util.Date
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat
val from = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd").parse(fromDate)
val to   = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd").parse(toDate)
val (fd,fm,fy) = (new SimpleDateFormat("dd").format(from), from.getMonth, (1900 +from.getYear))
val (td,tm,ty) = (new SimpleDateFormat("dd").format(to),   to.getMonth,   (1900 +to.getYear))

case class StockData (sym : String, Date: java.sql.Date, Open :Double, High : Double, Low: Double, Close:Double, Volume: Int, AdjClose: Double)

val curlStrs = stocks.map(symbol => (symbol, s"http://ichart.finance.yahoo.com/table.csv?s=$symbol&a=$fm&b=$fd&c=$fy&d=$tm&e=$td&f=$ty&g=d&ignore=.csv" ))

import sys.process._
val data = curlStrs
    .map{ case (sym, curlStr) => ("curl -s "+ curlStr !!)    // for each symbol call yahoo
    .split("\n")                                             // split the data into rows
      .tail                                                  // get all lines except header
      .map(_.split(","))                                     // put cols into array
      .map(x => StockData(sym, new java.sql.Date(new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd").parse(x(0)).getTime), x(1).toDouble, x(2).toDouble, x(3).toDouble, x(4).toDouble, x(5).toInt, x(6).toDouble) )
    }.flatten

sc.parallelize(data).toDF.registerTempTable("data")

paragraphs.title: Portfolio Stats
paragraphs.text:
%sql select sym, meanPrice, concat(avgReturn, "%") as totalReturn, stndDev, 
concat (ratio * 100, "%") as `ratio %`, 
initialAmt, (initialAmt + initialAmt * (avgReturn * 0.01 )) as currentValue  
from stats

%sql select sum (initialAmt) as initialAmt, 
sum( (initialAmt + initialAmt * (avgReturn * 0.01 ) )) as currentValue,
avg(avgReturn) as AvgReturn from stats

paragraphs.title: Portfolio Aggregate
paragraphs.text:
%sql select sum (initialAmt) as initialAmt, 
sum( (initialAmt + initialAmt * (avgReturn * 0.01 ) )) as currentValue,
concat (cast(sum(avgReturn * ratio) as int) , "%") as AvgWeightedReturn
from stats

paragraphs.title: Daily Value At Risk ( 1 Simulation for 100 future days)
paragraphs.text: %sql select  `interval`, symbol, perChange, ratio, (perChange * ratio) as weightedPrediction  from one_simulation order by `interval`

paragraphs.title: VaR Percentiles
paragraphs.text:
print("%table percentile\toutcome\t\n")
  println(f"$worst%1.2f" + "%\t worst")
  println(f"$typical%1.2f" + "%\t typical")
  println(f"$best%1.2f" + "%\t best")

paragraphs.title: Net Daily Change Percentage
paragraphs.text: %sql select `interval`, (totalChange * 100) as dailyChange from portfolio order by `interval`

paragraphs.title: Calculate Percentiles for Final Portfolio Dollar Value
paragraphs.text:
case class PortfolioOutcome (endingValue: Double)

finalPortfolioValue.map(x => PortfolioOutcome ( x )).toDF().registerTempTable("PortfolioOutCome")

val outcomePercentile = sqlContext.sql("""select explode (endingValue) as endingValue 
    from (select percentile_approx(endingValue, array(0.05,0.50,0.95)) as endingValue 
    from PortfolioOutCome ) t1""").collectAsList

val ninetyFive = outcomePercentile.get(0)(0).asInstanceOf[Double]
val likely     = outcomePercentile.get(1)(0).asInstanceOf[Double]
val five       = outcomePercentile.get(2)(0).asInstanceOf[Double]

result.msg:
defined class PortfolioOutcome

ninetyFive: Double = 16669.566497622713
likely: Double = 22269.471903316407

paragraphs.title: Portfolio Value After 100 Days, Simulated 10 Times
paragraphs.text:
print("%table Percentile\tDollar Amount Outcome\t\n")
  println(f"$ninetyFive%1.2f" + "\t 95% confidence that your portfolio value will be at least this amount")
  println(f"$likely%1.2f" + "\t most likely outcome")
  println(f"$five%1.2f" +
  "\t 5% confidence that your portfolio value will reach this amount")

paragraphs.text:
case class test (interval: Int, symbol:String, value:Double, weight: Double )

sc.parallelize(
    List(test(1,"msft", 10.0, .4),
        test(1, "msft", 12.0, .6),
        test(1, "msft", 14.0, .6),
        test(1, "msft", 16.0, .6),
        test(1, "msft", 18.0, .6)
        )
).toDF.registerTempTable("test")
